comments.body: Does this mean that we ignored the first argument before?
Oh, the opposite in fact.

related to a recent fix that went in, sorry should have xref'd it. our
scheduler used to build poorly formed commandInfo.Arguments. I fixed it,
which introduced an extra arg at the beginning. which means that we should
ignore the additional arg here (read: this wants to ignore the "km"
"minion" args from the command line)

On Fri, Mar 4, 2016 at 11:01 AM, Dr. Stefan Schimanski <
notifications@github.com> wrote:

> In contrib/mesos/pkg/minion/server.go
> https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/22500#discussion_r55047580
> :
> 
> > @@ -164,7 +164,7 @@ func (ms *MinionServer) launchProxyServer() {
> >  // executor doesn't support failover right now, the right thing to do is to fail completely since all
> >  // pods will be lost upon restart and we want mesos to recover the resources from them.
> >  func (ms *MinionServer) launchExecutorServer(containerID string) <-chan struct{} {
> > -   allArgs := os.Args[1:]
> > -   allArgs := os.Args[2:]
> 
> Oh, the opposite in fact.
> 
> 窶能n> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/22500/files#r55047580.

@jdef, looks like there is still a case where arg parsing would break: if --executor-path flag set on km scheduler:
https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/679e27c157637290075e65a45dfc0fde0a5c32d9/contrib/mesos/pkg/scheduler/service/service.go#L385

thanks for reviewing this change. the minion is only executable via "km
minion" right now, there is no separate binary. so even if you were
wrapping with a custom script and specifying an executor-path, you'd still
need to invoke "km minion ..args" which means that the first two command
line args may be safely stripped. if we ever support running the "km
minion" service outside of the km binary then .. yes this assumption
breaks. however, we have no immediate plans to support that.

does that make sense, or am I still overlooking something?

i want to clarify my previous comment: you're not required to run "km
minion" in a custom executor script, you're welcome to spin up the
kubelet-executor and kube-proxy in some custom script and totally ignore
the minion glue. but the minion code is where the first 2 args are stripped
from the command line, and the only way to run the minion code is via "km
minion"

SGTM.
the logic in this else block will execute every time we encounter an env var that's not PATH. this is probably not what we want
The else-block only executes for variables which start with `PATH=`.

you're right. i should avoid doing code reviews when I'm so tired.

Fixed in scheduler-refactoring branch.
:+1:  I always have a similar patch in my local checkout
Shouldn't this go into the if-clause as well?
no
my intent was specifically to provide `--resource-container` all the time, and only specify `--cgroup-root` when there actually was one to specify.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +154,158 @@	executorArgs, _ := filterArgsByFlagSet(allArgs, executorFlags)

	executorArgs = append(executorArgs, "--resource-container="+path.Join("/", ms.cgroupRoot, "kubelet"))
	if ms.cgroupRoot != "" {
		executorArgs = append(executorArgs, "--cgroup-root="+ms.cgroupRoot)

comments.body: I am a bit puzzled why we need this error and task completion aggregation logic in the taskEvents interface. Here, right now we don't need it. Do we really need it for some later apiserver task completion notification? In the current state it feels very over-engineered.

came in handy for unit testing (which we didn't have at all before). this todo was just a random idea that occurred to me, something that I thought might be useful for operators at some point; there's no urgency for it.

i'm pretty hesitant to eliminate the events stuff since I think it helps testability and establishes a foundation for (possibly) reporting component failure events/metrics. if it's too complex, I'm open to other ideas. the prior state of process management didn't quite compare to what s6 was offering us before. this comes much closer.

If you abstract error and taskCompletion into some sum type (interface or struct), a lot of that logic will be trivial. No waiting groups, no code duplication. Now it's 50% of the code and it is hard to read.

couple of thoughts:
- avoid two calls to `os.Environ()`; DRY
- is this worth parameterizing? for example `./km minion --ensure-path=/usr/sbin:/sbin`
  - this would append each entry if it wasn't present in the existing PATH list
  - flag would need to propagate from scheduler invocation
yes, I like the idea to use a flag. It's pretty system dependent and shouldn't be hardcoded.

I don't like the proposed magic combining the actual and given paths. The path is pretty host-dependent. If there is a need to change it, the user must know what he is doing. I implemented it as "path-override" for that reason, plain and explicit.
nit: remove this blank line
It was intentional to separate it from the log configs.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +52,56 @@
	pathOverride string // the PATH environment for the sub-processes

	logMaxSize      resource.Quantity
	logMaxBackups   int

comments.body: Why not embed?
I prefer that to be explicit because it's not really clean right now to do this instantiation of `KubeletExecutorServer` at all. With a multiflags approach for the km tool, this will go away.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +41,45 @@	// embed the executor server to be able to use its flags
	// TODO(sttts): get rid of this mixing of the minion and the executor server with a multiflags implementation for km
	KubeletExecutorServer *exservice.KubeletExecutorServer

	privateMountNS bool

comments.body: Comments please.
`close(ms.exit)`?
added a comment. Closing ms.exit leads to panics for the go routines writing to it. We had that before and changed it.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +136,140 @@
	log.Info("Executor exited cleanly, stopping the minion")
	ms.exit <- nil
}
